sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations with non-square matrices
message_1:
A system of linear equations:

2x + 3y + 4z = 5

3x + 5y - 2z = 7

4x - y + 2z = 1

Use the method of your choice to find the values of x, y, and z.
message_2:
I will use the Gaussian elimination method to solve this system of linear equations.

First, I will write the augmented matrix for the given system:

| 2  3  4 | 5
| 3  5 -2 | 7
| 4 -1  2 | 1

Next, I will perform row operations to get the matrix in row-echelon form:

1. Swap Row 1 and Row 3:

| 4 -1  2 | 1
| 3  5 -2 | 7
| 2  3  4 | 5

2. Multiply Row 1 by 1/4:

| 1 -1/4  1/2 | 1/4
| 3  5   -2   | 7
| 2  3    4   | 5

3. Replace Row 2 with Row 2 - 3*Row 1 and Row 3 with Row 3 - 2*Row 1:

|  1  -1/4  1/2  |  1/4
|  0  19/4 -7/2  | 25/4
|  0  11/2  3    |  9/2

4. Multiply Row 2 by 4/19:

|  1  -1/4  1/2  |  1/4
|  0   1   -14/19| 10/19
|  0  11/2  3    |  9/2

5. Replace Row 1 with Row 1 + 1/4*Row 2 and Row 3 with Row 3 - 11/2*Row 2:

|  1   0   3/4  |  3/4
|  0   1  -14/19| 10/19
|  0   0   97/19|  7/19

6. Multiply Row 3 by 19/97:

|  1   0   3/4  |  3/4
|  0   1  -14/19| 10/19
|  0   0    1   |  7/97

Now, we have the matrix in row-echelon form, and we can perform back-substitution to find the values of x, y, and z:

z = 7/97

y = 10/19 + 14/19 * z = 10/19 + 14/19 * (7/97) = 10/19 + 98/97 = (210 + 98) / 97 = 308/97

x = 3/4 - 3/4 * z - 1/4 * y = 3/4 - 3/4 * (7/97) - 1/4 * (308/97) = (72 - 21 - 77) / 97 = -26/97

So, the solution to the system of linear equations is:

x = -26/97
y = 308/97
z = 7/97
